>So said hehaifengcn on 2003-06-10 --------------------
>I have a project i=
n which I want to some tools that can automatically 
>generate test case to=
 exercise given execution path. The path is 
>derived from bytecode but may=
 be ablt to map back to source code 
>level. 
>
>For example, I have a fuct=
ion
>
>void fun(int a, int b)
>{
>1  a=3Db;
>2  if (a<b){
>3     x=3Da;
>4 =
 }else{
>5    x=3Db;
>6}
>7
>}
>
>And suppose I want the execution path is =
(1,2, 3, 7). I need a tool 
>for generating an input for the path. 
>
>I tr=
y to use JTest  but not able to find any feature in Jtest which 
>can do th=
e task. I wonder if there any tool which has that feature? 
>Can JUnit perf=
orm it?

The idea of automatically generating tests is incompatible with th=
e JUnit (and xUnit) philosophy. JUnit is a framework in which humans write =
tests; it is not a tool that writes tests.

An interesting question for you=
: how do you expect any program to know the expected result for each code p=
ath? The key point of tests is to compare an expected result to the actual =
result. How is it possible for a non-human to know the expected result?

Ta=
ke care.
